subject: Politics
title: Human Rights
description: A micro-lesson that makes Human Rights usable.

hook.text: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights was written in 1948 after the worst atrocity in history. Never again.

buildup.text: Human rights are claims that every person holds simply by being human, regardless of nationality or law.

discovery.text: The UDHR lists 30 articles covering life, liberty, equality, education, and freedom from torture and slavery.

twist.text: Critics call human rights Western imperialism. Others ask who enforces them when powerful nations violate them.

climax.text: Despite imperfect enforcement, human rights set the standard. They give the oppressed a language to demand change.

punchline.text: Human rights are imperfect. They're still the best tool the powerless have.

quiz.question: When was the Universal Declaration of Human Rights adopted?
options: 1948, after World War II and the Holocaust
1776, alongside the US Declaration of Independence
1991, after the fall of the Soviet Union
